results.title: Child's play
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, Malcolm Otton and Antonio Colacino
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “The Developing child”.
With the ability to walk, the child reaches a major milestone along the road to adulthood. One day they will leave their family’s care and face the world alone. The toddler asserts their new sense of independence. Suitable for teacher/tertiary level.

results.title: Child's horizon
results.brief_description: Outlines the work of UNICEF in attempting to counter some of the causes of blindness in children: malnutrition, cataracts, infections and accidents. Also highlights factors that agravate the spread of disease - Poverty, ignorance, crowded living conditions, lack of clear water and poor sanitation.
results.description: Outlines the work of UNICEF in attempting to counter some of the causes of blindness in children: malnutrition, cataracts, infections and accidents. results.title: Child's guide to languages
results.brief_description: Presents the latests educational theories about how children and adults acquire language. Shows an immersion approach in a Canadian school where English-speaking children are taught in the French language, learn to speak French as well as native speakers and do not lose their English. The views of noted language theorist Dr Stephen Krashner are given throughout the program.

results.title: Chik's great adventure
results.brief_description: The story of Scouting in Malaya. Chik’s “great adventure” began when he joined the Boy Scouts because scouting gave him adventure, companionship, healthy activity and an opportunity for service in his community. The film provides useful information on the aims and objects of the Scout Movement in Malaya.
results.description: The story of Scouting in Malaya. results.title: Chiens Perdus Sans Collier = Lost Dogs Without Collar
results.brief_description:
Judge Lamy is presiding the Juvenile Court. Under a rough outlook, he is hiding a deep sense of compassion for all the young peole in trouble he tries to help. One day, the young Alain-Robert is brought before him, charged with setting fire to his employer’s farm as a revenge for all the beatings he received. Later on, Francis, gets caught stealing in the changing rooms of a football club.

Credits: Director, Jean Delannoy ; writers, Jean Aurenche, Pierre Bost, Francois Boyer ; photography, Pierre Montazel ; music, Paul Misraki.
Cast: Jean Gabin, Anne Doat, Serge Lecointe, Jacques Moulieres, Dora Doll, Jane Marken.

results.title: Chief telegraph office
results.brief_description: Uses period footage and oral history interviews to trace the 133 years of telegraphy in Victoria, from the Eureka stockade rebellion and the bombing of Darwin to the private joys and sorrows of births, deaths and marriages.
results.description: Uses period footage and oral history interviews to trace the 133 years of telegraphy in Victoria, from the Eureka stockade rebellion and the bombing of Darwin to the private joys and sorrows of births, deaths and marriages.

results.title: Chicks With Decks
results.brief_description: A documentary about teenage Australian girls with a love for skateboards and making rhymes. This student work features spectacular skateboarding footage.

results.title: Chicks and chickens
results.brief_description: Follows the incubation and hatching of a brood of chicks, and shows a hen as she protects her chicks and teaches them to find food. Suitable for primary school level.
